Message.Title: And Now for Something Completely Different
Message.Msg: The Washington Post's Style Invitational asked readers to take any word from the dictionary, alter it by adding, subtracting, or changing one letter, and supply a new definition. Here are some recent winners. Reintarnation: Coming back to life as a hillbilly. Foreploy: Any misrepresentation about yourself for the purpose of getting laid. Giraffiti: Vandalism spray-painted very, very high. Sarchasm: The gulf between the author of sarcastic wit and the person who doesn't get it. Inoculatte: To take coffee intravenously when you are running late. Hipatitis: Terminal coolness. Osteopornosis: A degenerate disease. Karmageddon: It's like, when everybody is sending off all these really bad vibes, right? And then, like, the Earth explodes and it's like, a serious bummer. Glibido: All talk and no action. Dopeler effect: The tendency of stupid ideas to seem smarter when they come at you rapidly. Intaxication: Euphoria at getting a tax refund, which lasts until you realize it was your money to start with. Ignoranus: A person who's both stupid and an #$%$.

Message.Title: Two Wolves
Message.Msg: Two Wolves A tribal elder tells his grandson of the battle all people wage within themselves. He says “My son, it is a struggle between two wolves. One is evil, full of ego, envy, greed, resentment, fear, anger, hate and violence. The other is good, full of joy, love, hope, serenity, humility, generosity, truth, compassion and faith.” The boy contemplates this for a while and then asks “Grandfather, which wolf will win?” Answers Grandfather “The one you feed my son, the one you feed.”

Topic.Title: FROM THE MINSTRY OF TRUTH..Google reports spike in requests to remove content

Message.Msg: For how could you establish even the most obvious fact when there existed no record outside your own memory? He tried to remember in what year he had first heard mention of Big Brother. He thought it must have been at some time in the sixties, but it was impossible to be certain. In the Party histories, of course, Big Brother figured as the leader and guardian of the Revolution since its very earliest days. His exploits had been gradually pushed backwards in time until already they extended into the fabulous world of the forties and the thirties, when the capitalists in their strange cylindrical hats still rode through the streets of London in great gleaming motor-cars or horse carriages with glass sides. There was no knowing how much of this legend was true and how much invented. Winston could not even remember at what date the Party itself had come into existence. (1.3.22)

Topic.Title: Chief Engineer on 787 Says that the plane is perfectly safe....

Message.Msg: He said there was no fire in the battery box. The "smoke" seen was the overheated electrolite gas, not smoke. He said there were small flames from two connectors outside the battery box. That is why the changes made include changing the connectors.

Message.Title: ANA 787 took battery test flight Sunday w/ Ray Connor on board
Message.Msg: TOKYO (Reuters) - All Nippon Airways , the Japanese launch customer for Boeing Co's (BA.N) 787, flew its first Dreamliner in more than three months on Sunday to test reinforced batteries installed by the U.S. aircraft maker. The ANA flight, with company president Shinichiro Ito and Boeing's chief of commercial aircraft, Ray Conner, among those on board, left Tokyo's Haneda airport at 8:59 a.m. local time. It returned without incident at 10:54 a.m...., The ANA flight was the second by an airline since aviation regulators on Friday gave permission for 787 operations to restart after batteries on two of them overheated in mid January. One was on an ANA plane in Japan and another on a Japan Airlines jet parked at Boston's Logan airport. Ethiopian Airlines (ETHA.UL) on Saturday became the world's first carrier to resume flying Dreamliner passenger jets since the global fleet was grounded three months ago, carrying passengers to neighboring Kenya from Ethiopia.

Message.Msg: I forgot to mention that when you extend the multi-spectrum sensor turret (we call it the eyeball) from the belly of the chopper, it sometimes disrupts the engine/rotor "whisper" mode. Which means to be safe, you have to lower it soon after takeoff and fly with it in the deployed position all the way to the scene of action, accepting the aerodynamic penalties involved. It's going to be hard to take over the world with shoddy equipment like this. I can't wait till we get the Mark IV black helicopters, when these bugs will be fixed.

Message.Msg: Compare Boeing to Airbus using the yahoo finance stock chart select BA then select, " compare" and type in Airbus symbol, " EADSY" and then just select the period of time that you wish to compare. Max shows Airbus shareholders made 70% compared tothe boeing shareholders losing about 5% scroll along the periods of time and it is very clear all the Boeing Hacks that use their public advertisement and rotten notes to or about me are just that. The facts are if your a boeing shareholder your not as finanically well off as a Airbus shareholder. BTW Airbus does not have a message board here so Boeing is the best place to post about the duopoly. Getting back to the comparison, for , 5 years Airbus shareholders made 100% gain on their stock compared to Boeing shareholders making zero, you can read along this site it is clear that boeing is a dead cat bouce stock. 2 year Airbus returned 70% Boeing 19%, I year Airbus returned 30%, Boeing 21%, 6 months Airbus returned 50% , Boeing 32%, Year to date Airbus returned 35%, Boeing 22%. the main difference is since the 787 was grounded Boeign has been buying back their shares to make a fantasy gain, it is not a real stock market investment. It is a Boeing company buyback . Airbus has one too, if needed 15% of their stock has been authorised for a buy back. Topic.Title: Boeing stock price is up over the time the 787 was grounded

Message.Msg: Wayne, you asked me to post dates and prices, which I did on April 25th, and will post here again. Wayne, Wayne, Wayne, do we have to show you how to look up historical BA values? Go to the "historical prices" tab in BA Yahoo. Enter start dates from about Feb1, 2009 to end dates of about April 30, 2009. You will see that the bottom of 29.36 accured on March 3, 2009 for a gain of 213 percent to today's 92. My earlier post used the April 20, 2009 value of 36.48 to get the 4 year gain of about 150 percent. My math says 150 percent for 4 years is better than Airbus 127 percent gain in 5 years. It's OK to admit you make a mistake once in a while. You probably shouldn't call someone a liar until you have checked the facts. And here's part of your post: "and yoru 150% for 4 years is total crapola btw boeing hit a statiically bottom as you know at about 55 and at 90 that is not a gain of 150%" Still calling me a liar about the 4 year gain? A lot of current Boeing employees probably bought BA thru the Boeing Savings Plan program and dollar-cost-averaging have made a good return the last 4 years. More when its low and less when its high.
